Arisi Upma Kavitha Ramaswamy 1 hour 30 minutes 1 hour 30 minutes 4 cups Breakfast South-Indian 0 Aug 03, 2019 https://foodomania.com/arisi-upma-recipe-rice-upma/
Steamed
arisi upma, arisi upma recipe, rice upma Instructions?#&?#&Grind together the ingredients mentioned under “Spice Powder”. Set aside.?#&To a pressure cooker, add 4 Tablespoons of Vegetable Oil and let it get hot.?#&Add the Asafetida powder (Hing) and fry for 20 seconds.?#&Add the Dry Red Chili and Black Mustard Seeds. Let the seeds splutter.?#&Add the Cumin (jeera) and Black Peppercorns, Chana Dal and Urad Dal. ?#&Fry till the seeds are golden (for 30-40 seconds).?#&Add the green chili, curry leaves and ginger. Fry well for 10-20 seconds.?#&Add 2-2.5 cups of Water and bring it to a boil.?#&Add the freshly grated coconut and salt and mix well. (You can taste the water here to check for salt and adjust if needed).?#&Add all of the Ground Spice Powder and mix well.?#&Keep the stove on low flame. Slowly add the rice and keep stirring until the it is all in. Keep stirring and cooking on low heat for 1-2 minutes until the rice rava has started to cook.?#&Close the cooker, put the lid on and cook on medium heat for 3 Whistles.?#&Let the pressure release completely.?#&Open the lid and use a forked spoon or the back of a spatula to fluff up the upma,?#&?#&Serving Suggestion –?#&?#&Serve it with your favorite chutney or sambar varieties?#&Or you can make the Eggplant Gothsu, which is a more traditionaly tangy gravy based dish that is served with Arisi Upma?#&?#&If you don’t have a pressure cooker …?#&?#&You can cook on a large pot on non-stick pan with high sides. DO the same steps as above. ?#&Close the lid, and cook on a simmer for 15-20 minutes until the rice upma is done Ingredients for Arisi Upma?#&?#&4 Tablespoons Vegetable Oil?#&1/4 inch or 1 teaspoon Asafetida powder (Hing)?#&2 pieces Broken Dry Red Chili?#&2 Tablespoons Black Mustard Seeds (Rai / Kadugu) ?#&1 Tablespoon Cumin seeds (Jeera)?#&1 teapsoon Black Peppercorns?#&1 Tablespoon Chana Dal?#&1 Tablespoon Urad Dal?#&2 Green Chili (adjust for spice)?#&1 cup fresh Curry Leaves?#&2 Tablespoons fresh Ginger, grated or finely chopped?#&1/2 cup freshly grated Coconut?#&2 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 cup Broken Rice or Rice Rava?#&Spice Powder (as prepared above)?#&2 cups Water (adjust if required more or less)?#&?#&Note on Water?#&?#&For 1 cup of the rice, you will need around 2 cups of water?#&?#&Note on Rice Rava or Broken Rice?#&?#&Wash 2–3 cups of White Rice well. ?#&Dry it completey on a clean cloth.?#&Grind coarsely and use as required?#&OR buy readymade Rice Rava from the store https://i0.wp.com/foodomania.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Arisi-Upma-Recipe-by-Foodomania-South-Indian-Rice-Upma-02.jpg?fit=615%2C457&ssl=1
Aloo Paratha Kavitha Ramaswamy 1 hour 30 minutes 1 hour 30 minutes 8 Lunch / Dinner Indian 1 Aug 02, 2019 https://foodomania.com/aloo-paratha-recipe/
punjabi aloo paratha, alu ke parathe, indian potato flatbread Instructions?#&?#&For the Dough?#&?#&In a mixing bowl, add the flour, salt and oil (or ghee) and mix well.?#&Add half of the water first and mix everything together. The dough will start to come together, but still be crumbly. (It is a good idea to taste a tiny portion here to test for salt and adjust, if required)?#&Keep adding more water and bringing the dough together.?#&Once the dough is formed, knead it well for about 8-10 minutes or until the dough is smooth, soft and shiny.?#&Cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for at least 30 minutes?#&Tip: it is important for the dough to be soft and smooth. This helps in rolling out even-layered parathas?#&?#&For the Stuffing?#&?#&Cook the potatoes until they are soft. Peel them and add them to a mixing bowl.?#&Use a fork or your hands to mash the potatoes finely.?#&Add rest of the spices, salt, coriander leaves, ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chili.?#&Mix everything together well. Taste and adjust for seasoning, if required.?#&Set aside for further use.?#&?#&Making the Aloo Paratha?#&?#&Form equal, medium-sized balls of dough. Keep them covered.?#&Take a ball of dough and flatten it slightly (about 4-5 inches diameter). If the dough is sticky or hard to work with, you can use some whole-wheat flour to dust the surface.?#&Place 1-2 Tablespoons of the potato stuffing in the center of the flattened dough, leaving at least 2-3 inches space around it.?#&Take the edges of the dough and start pleating them to bring them to thecenter (right above the stuffing). Pinch out the excess dough.?#&Roll the dough ball gently and place it on the work surface. Flatten it again.?#&Using a rolling pin, gently roll it out to an even-layered Paratha. It can be of any thickness you prefer. But usually, a 1/2 inch thickness is good enough.?#&Heat a flat pan / griddle / tawa. To the hot tawa, place the rolled-out paratha in the middle.?#&Let it cook partially on one side for about 30-45 seconds. Flip the paratha.?#&Add some vegetable oil or ghee all over the on the partially cooked part. ?#&Use a spatula / spoon to press the paratha, to ensure the other side cooks well and gets crispy. Cook for 30-45 seconds on until the side is cooked.?#&Flip again. And this time, add some grease (oil or ghee) to the other part pf the paratha. Press again for 20-30 seconds until the other side is cooked too.?#&Repeat the same process with the rest of the dough.?#&?#&To Serve + Store the Paratha?#&?#&Serve hot with a dollop of butter (optional)?#&Serve them with your favorite pickle, dahi or any chutney or condiment you like. (Some pickle options to consider: Tomato Garlic Pickle, Green Chili Pickle, and Mango Pickle)?#&Store them in a casserole or a dish, with a kitchen cloth cover to keep them soft.?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&The pan (tawa) should be hot and not at medium or low heat. Cooking the parathas on a medium or low heat will harden them. Cooking them at high temperatures will ensure that the parathas are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.?#&You can use as much grease (vegetable oil or ghee) as you want to cook the parathas! You can make a low-fat version by adding only a teaspoon of the grease per paratha or you can even deep fry them! Totally upto you.?#&A good Aloo Paratha will puff up. For this, you will need to roll them to a thin, even layer. Ingredients?#&?#&For the Dough?#&?#&2 cups Whole-Wheat Flour (gehun ka atta)?#&1/3 teaspoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 Tablespoon Vegetable Oil or Ghee?#&1/2 cup Water. for kneading (you may need more or less, depending on the flour)?#&?#&For the Stuffing?#&?#&4 medium-sized Potatoes?#&1 teaspoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 teaspoon minced Ginger?#&1 teaspoon grated Garlic?#&2–4 finely chopped Green Chilies?#&1/2 cup finely chopped Coriander Leaves (Cilantro)?#&1/2 teaspoon Aamchur (Dry Mango Powder)?#&1 teaspoon Garam Masala Powder ?#&1 teaspoon Red Chilli Powder?#&1 teaspoon Cumin Powder?#&?#&To Cook the Aloo Paratha?#&?#&Whole-wheat flour, for dusting?#&Vegetable Oil, as required?#&?#&Serving options?#&?#&Cold, plain Yogurt (dahi)?#&Any Indian Pickle (like aam ka achaar)?#&Ketchup, chutney etc.?#&?#&Note?#&?#&You can flavor the potato stuffing however you desire https://i2.wp.com/foodomania.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Aloo-Paratha-Recipe-by-Foodomania.jpg?fit=615%2C615&ssl=1
Domino’s style Garlic Breadsticks Kavitha Ramaswamy 2 hours 30 mins 2 hours 30 mins 18 Appetizer Italian-American 0 Aug 28, 2017 https://foodomania.com/dominos-style-garlic-breadsticks/
Instructions?#&?#&Dough?#&?#&To lukewarm water, add some sugar, yeast and mix well. Let the mixture sit for 2 minutes until the yeast turns frothy.?#&Add some flour and salt and mix well to form a smooth batter.?#&Close with a damp cloth or plastic wrap and let it rest for around 30 minutes. The mixture will bubble up.?#&To this mix, add the remaining flour, salt, melted butter or oil and mix well. Knead to form a smooth dough.?#&Add some oil to the dough and the bowl and rub it well.?#&Cover with a lid / damp cloth and let it sit in a warm spot for 45 minutes to an hour or until the dough plumps up in size (doubles in volume).?#&?#&Garlic Butter?#&?#&Meanwhile, make the garlic butter. To a blender, add garlic cloves, green chilli, fresh cilantro leaves.?#&Grind to a coarse paste.?#&Add the garlic-chilli paste to melted butter and mix well.?#&?#&To form the Garlic Breadsticks?#&?#&Add the dough to a clean work surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out to a 1 inch thick circle.?#&Add the garlic butter and spread all over the surface.?#&Sprinkle some oregano or pizza seasoning all over. Add some grated cheese, if required.?#&Fold the circle from one end to form a tight semi-circle.?#&Carefully lift it and place it on a prepared baking pan. Use a fork or your fingers to seal the edges all around the semi-circle.?#&Brush with some more garlic butter / melted butter.?#&Cover loosely & let it sit in a warm spot for 20-30 minutes. It will plump up.?#&Once the dough has risen the second time, use a knife to gently cut the semi-circle into equal sticks. You don’t have to go all the way down or separate the sticks. But making these markings with a knife will help you pull the sticks apart easily.?#&Sprinkle some oregano/ pizza or pasta seasoning all over the top and bake at 180 C for 30-40 minutes or until the garlic breadsticks are fully cooked through.?#&Brush with some melted butter on top, if required. Serve warm as is or with your favorite dipping sauce Ingredients?#&?#&For the dough?#&?#&1/2 cup Water?#&1/2 teaspoon Sugar?#&1 teaspoon Instant Yeast (or 1.5 teaspoons Active Dry Yeast)?#&1/4 teaspoon Salt?#&1 and 1/4 cup Flour?#&3 Tablespoons Vegetable Oil or Melted Butter?#&?#&Garlic Butter?#&?#&1/4 cup Garlic Cloves?#&2–4 Green Chilli?#&1/2 cup fresh Cilantro or Coriander or Parsley?#&3 Tablespoons Butter?#&?#&Others – adjust to taste?#&?#&Pizza / Pasta seasoning?#&Oregano?#&Grated Cheese?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&You can use store bought garlic butter too https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/HpNfVOrcqHIR69s2vjnjvRGobqXGrZhxNmixWAcR1p2eppeAVjKq2QF7bFxnzEPcOU-447liaIAPUaeYe6c2HKNdkXYcnwQ7BNwIRaVXbwSvSFSzBydOavOiVz7FVIzMByUzwQmdEJkvEzWMcQWetH0IWC-UHXsx_BRS2EM3BtFfE9cbv4Lp0I5iGw_LowYTvUfAxccwBq8Kl8Bl_3vSc6IQ7GHuyy0LUw86ic9Q_KxjuU99qQmTqdyhEzP6WuRFr4R4maxNWWVYlBwELHHC8T_Mf5z7-2ycIvmsq9IBajvIky2yDNcp-yk8OQojquo0PWbJbywbl0YFaKdl3EPzU10sBfVfPPcmkptVFpvxIw6yduUY2r-hYhyiMRhj90X02tRmMmk624GFTHbcKFtSwZGbwmAjQW-y1ynQanCjkjBlY3PWh-7QR78SwYvyzvwozdXA2jXXgPk8h6-3Zz90RegVqR5zbBTPp_0SY6SbBtnFR7RWVL1u6SkNJ19HnSVgY7MeZUxM7QbgBMaG_hMjsGd0bLkSbt7tUa2-0zuT57LPcVC7jK22123VDGRuAWOJWwYvS9tPL6JJONW-uRM6ZoQ8uwBBrtDaA4Re8VV1SnuRnI2mvKgL=w628-h413-no
Cheese-stuffed Burgers Kavitha Ramaswamy 1 hour 20 mins 1 hour 20 mins 4 Main American 2 Jun 27, 2017 https://foodomania.com/cheese-stuffed-burgers-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&To a blender, add peas, chilli, garlic, cilantro and onion. Grind to form a smooth paste.?#&Mash potatoes. Add ground peas mixture to the potatoes.?#&Add spices – salt, pepper, sugar, cumin, garam masala etc. Mix well.?#&Add some breadcrumbs and cornstarch and mix well to form a thick burger patty mixture. Taste and adjust for seasoning.?#&Divide the mixture into equal portions. Form a thin patty and add some cheese in the center. You can add sliced cheese or grated cheese. Form another thin patty and place it on top of the first patty with cheese. Press on all sides to seal the cheese completely. If the cheese is getting out, just press in and form a neat patty. Form all patties like this.?#&Heat a couple tablespoons of oil on the non-stick pan and add the patties. Cook on medium heat on both sides for 4-5 minutes or until the patties is cooked on the inside and crispy golden brown on the outside.?#&?#&To serve?#&?#&Toast some burger buns (optional).?#&Add some of the Apple Onion Chutney on the bottom and top buns.?#&Place the patty on the lower half.?#&Top off the patty with some fresh Pico de Gallo Salsa.?#&Close with the top bun and serve?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&You can add any spices you like to the burger patty mixture to make it your own version!?#&Pico de Gallo adds a freshness to the burger while the sweet-spicy apple onion chutney adds depth of flavor. But you can use any veggies and condiments you prefer on your burgers. Ingredients?#&?#&For the Patty?#&?#&4 medium Potatoes, boiled & peeled?#&1 cup Green Peas, boiled & soft?#&2 Garlic Cloves?#&2 Green Chilli?#&1/4 cup Cilantro?#&1/2 an Onion?#&2 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 teaspoon ground Black Pepper?#&a pinch of Sugar?#&1 teaspoon Cumin Powder (optional)?#&1 teaspoon Coriander Powder or Garam Masala (optional)?#&2 Tablespoons Cornstrach / Cornflour?#&1/4 cup Breadcrumbs?#&Slice Cheese or Grated Cheese?#&Vegetable Oil, for shallow frying?#&?#&To Serve?#&?#&Burger Buns?#&Pico de Gallo Salsa?#&Apple Onion Chutney?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&If you don’t want to make Pico de Gallo salsa, you can simply slice some onion & tomato and add it on the burger?#&If you don’t have or want to make Apple Onion Chutney, you can use any sweet-and-salty relish / dip you like. This sweet-salty condiment cuts the richness of the cheese-stuffed patty and lends a great flavor to the burger. If not, use any ketchup/mayo/spread you like. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/uvkfqb7AmBMTXTH1tCH1Psa-Vjh7Uxe2ezPJw-2eDOOr48cmJrLmuRsz0kv3uMWsMw8XVZw8koksrIoOxr6lI6KoGWS-erPem8d4S2ZE9qDNwg_Fcoqh_ug0zdBO_Q5RhLs0cWLX6z8EqItOvSnAwFsA-7LGTHh2ujY6UmPxTNalbwvZOUtxv5EWCxrGz2QPWLM6OKFDzVs4jlD8Ur_a_zSIYkvsPXQA2-3QshVaqRk4HweUzUtRe4W-QTsNW325kr-V__pbi9KKIp6AUQs6W-h0HeG9ao4kpW-q2RtT8SOi-5XHRcZ3cJDavcRBl2DqeaRDsY7x8Zw5ff-d7joNkX0O3EWh2kjEyWrZnJHVe8l6A76QKtb2FK-y0rGhvyAxDuxbz3PS8OgKLbAtFSRgaiu6w9nAKW9pPjpdmw8ahcsMSL1YqaJXGLRFDzzfVi1gUd4TDf_LfNJ1kK0jo0kxVjAI7Pn1wIdlkal-mhp7xZPvBAFtwnGIhfyuON4LIglMvELeYPMYTf-Ghl8JiqOmQqtRnUd3IMlHzmgr8Ee44Uoj81af9tZbHOQLKJ98eIISDy70sUg5RY4FCHf7YonQd63gARXrmTttXNLPEAvpB-etf6oHgqr_=w1060-h802-no
Chargrilled Pepper Cream Cheese Rolls Kavitha Ramaswamy 1 hour 20 mins 1 hour 20 mins 12
0 Sep 15, 2017 https://foodomania.com/chargrilled-pepper-cream-cheese-rolls/
Instructions?#&?#&Filling?#&?#&Grill some sliced bell peppers on a grill pan with some oil and add salt to taste. (alternatively, you can also sautee them)?#&Then add the veggies to some cream cheese.?#&Add some ground black pepper and mix well.?#&Taste and adjust for seasoning.?#&You can make the filling a day in advance.?#&?#&Making the rolls?#&?#&Preheat oven to 180 C. GRease and line a baking pan.?#&Roll out the dough into a 9X13 inch rectangle upto 1 inch thickness. Cut it into equal portions.?#&Take each piece of dough, add some of the filling in the middle.?#&Bring all four sides to the center and seal it. Then roll into a neat ball of dough.?#&Place all the prepared rolls on a baking sheet.?#&Brush with butter or buttermilk or milk.?#&Bake at 180 C for 15 minutes or until the rolls are cooked through.?#&Serve fresh with your favorite condiment.?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&You have to work quickly with buttermilk biscuit dough. The trick is to not let the butter melt. So if at any point you feel like the butter sealed in the dough is melting, return the dough back to the fridge for 5 minutes. Ingredients?#&?#&Filling?#&?#&1/2 cup Cream Cheese (at room temperature)?#&1 cup sliced Bell Peppers (refer note 1)?#&1/4 teaspoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1/2 teaspoon Ground Black Pepper?#&1 teaspoon Vegetable Oil?#&?#&Others?#&?#&1 lb Buttermilk Biscuit Dough (refer note 2)?#&Butter / Milk?#&?#&Note 1 – Bell Peppers?#&?#&Use the yellow and red bell peppers for best flavor. They turn sweet when roasted/sauteed/grilled. The green bell pepper tends to turn a bit bitter.?#&?#&Note – Dough?#&?#&You can use homemade buttermilk biscuit dough (recipe on foodomania.com) or use store bough biscuit dough as well?#&You can even use pizza dough to make these rolls – but the texture of the rolls will of course be like bread and not flaky biscuits. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/6EKcwS0MYeuS3uG4CTDWo0ZrejIXpwZ3lhxzkWgoONv_tYfHMTHkPhNnjHSib29KvlBnILncyPXC4xWrdxcuPyyU08m8vXoSTMgUw6AuBFWbjGfqud1x7L6y3rIYzSvX-5cCiQp5EVlTWGi-vJoM22TFvGPIbiITm3Tm-G-qA-wkCpCNZ_a49xzOPxewCXwY_0KIPF34lZf43SMp7RbzpEnyJTY9EXhjFXTKyy9M8nEKsgwBxsyWeJjr-Wnsqkt_Anf5ZDncIM1WPYQYA3d0QHNbFsV2_74ghVuSJvcMYl-_bG8iwwsqVnCcZ7Xhgvn_yMQof0wZn0uzJ3X0oPh74_UTScDc_g-xwi29HFy0YZXqIHaE0t6uJ8HKHPR-W-2yfMSLS53xiopkUZADdVVveVorlvvEDRWHtbanI6Ozj11kSZXtM7gKpxf2p1dmn-yKLv_1-FvxkH-CuhWkUyrHk4uF0i66gmLnxOOCSvcNCURyKHRcj5mSBDIQDOprHZCzaRvVvvsw9AvrW_X4K_b-uHCFmBuouAxCujPJTr6txnhzmbNvrBkQVvevtkfUNUFxS1-00hx0jKb_50BLgUrIlGIn5lNeyln9sNvaBgLhyyWwI5VtaiKL=w710-h653-no
Caramel-stuffed Chocolate Cake Bombs Kavitha Ramaswamy 30 mins
30 mins 30 Dessert
2 Oct 03, 2017 https://foodomania.com/caramel-stuffed-chocolate-cake-bombs-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&Crush the cake with a fork or your fingers.?#&Add some chopped chocolate, chocolate ganache and mix well. The mixture will be sticky yet not runny.?#&Cover and freeze for 20 minutes. The cake mixture should be thick.?#&Take 1-2 Tablespoons of the mixture and roll it into a ball.?#&Create an indent in the center.?#&Place some solid caramel in the center and bring the cake mixture around it.?#&Re-roll into a neat tight ball.?#&Roll the ball in some chocolate sprinkles.?#&Repeat with rest if the mixture. Place all cake bombs in an airtight container and freeze until set. (2 hours or overnight)?#&Caramel-stuffed chocolate cake bombs ready to be served.?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&If the cake mixture is a bit too runny to be formed into balls – even after freezing – then add some more cake and mix well.?#&Always keep them refrigerated. These stay good for 1 week. Instructions?#&?#&Heat oil in a pan. Add minced garlic and chopped hot pepper flakes and fry for a few seconds. Then add veggies one by one (in the order it takes for them to cook) and cook them with a little salt.?#&Once the veggies are cooked, add some all purpose flour and mix it with the veggies.?#&Add some water / vegetable stock and let it boil for for 3-4 minutes or until the water thickens into a sauce-like consistency.?#&Add the boiled peas and sweet corn and broccoli.?#&Then add some ground black pepper, oregano, more salt if required and mix well.?#&Mix in some chopped parsley or cilantro.?#&Meanwhile, cook Spaghetti or any pasta al dente. – Boil enough water in a large pot and add a generous pinch of salt. Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook for 8 minutes or till it is cooked to perfection. Drain water and add the spaghetti or pasta back to the large pot.?#&Add the sauce and veggies mix to the pasta and mix well.?#&Taste and add more pasta seasoning if required.?#&Serve fresh Pasta Primavera. Ingredients?#&?#&1 lb Spaghetti or any Pasta of your choice?#&4 Tablespoons Vegetable Oil or Olive Oil?#&2 Tablespoons Minced Garlic?#&1 Tablespoons Red Chilli / Hot Pepper Flakes (adjust for spice)?#&4–5 cups of Mixed Veggies (Refer Note 1)?#&2 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 Tablespoon All Purpose Flour?#&1/2 cup Water or Vegetable Stock?#&1/2 cup Boiled Peas (lightly salted)?#&1/2 cup Boiled Sweet Corn (lightly salted)?#&1/2 cup cooked / steamed Broccoli (optional)?#&2 teaspoons Ground Black Pepper?#&2 teaspoons dried Oregano?#&1/2 cup fresh chopped Parsley or Cilantro?#&?#&Note 1 – Veggies – You can use any veggies you have on hand. Instructions?#&?#&Wash the basmati rice well. Then soak it in water for 30 minutes. Discard the water.?#&Similarly, wash the mint leaves (pudina) really well. You can roughly chop the leaves or use the whole leaves.?#&Heat oil in a non-stick pan with high sides. Add whole-spices (cinnamon, star anise, cloves), grated nutmeg spice and fry for 1 minutes. Then add the green chili, minced garlic and ginger and fry for 20 seconds.?#&Add the onions to mix well. Fry on medium heat until the onions have caramelized for 4-5 minutes.?#&Add the rice to the pan and mix it well with the onions and spices. Let it fry on medium heat for 2 minutes.?#&Add salt and mix well.?#&Then add the Mint Leaves (pudina) and mix well and fry for a minute.?#&Add water and mix well. Taste the water and adjust for salt if required.?#&Once the water comes to a boil, close with a lid, simmer the stove and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.?#&Open the lid, fluff up the rice. Discard the green chilli and whole spices.?#&Serve hot. It tastes great as is. Or you could serve it with some cold plain yogurt or raita Ingredients?#&?#&1 cup Basmati Rice?#&1 cup fresh Mint Leaves (pudina)?#&4 Tablespoons Vegetable Oil?#&2 inch Cinnamon Stick (dalchini)?#&4 Cloves (laung)?#&1 Star Anise?#&1/4 teaspoon Grated Nutmeg?#&4 Green Chili, slit in the middle (adjust per spice required)?#&1 teaspoon Grated Ginger?#&4 Garlic Cloves, minced?#&1 cup sliced Onions?#&1 Tablespoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1 3/4 cup Water (adjust per quality of rice you’re using)?#&?#&Water – Generally 1 cup of Basmati takes 1.5 to 2 cups of Water to cook well. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/HdE3yEbjNFagBnQWElDP8_HS2GmFMmMXFLrr3WYaLUv52QcRVm9H6AH0wgaBgtI681T5AhqUa31DfZlDiUdyoCgfl75AVizrtoNSB04R4rmSpJb8uFeQj454pPTt9VAtp8ITvUiTngewv1oOtclgCHD8HIeofxOh-RYcJVg1xn32-Oz-kF6rRSaMAFe6jaQA5t0fe3PSxOghYM_5QtZ0j60oYMnL5a2Kwwi3DTwcm2QYRflpTMOPDl7ajEO96GFxlx06TVNXfYJF1ubnBz6IhlDxJEtsUjwYIQKAVd1Yh7YWtzuB22mgl03YAINOJsK8VhlEsqAgoy6jTN9vmzvavlJ6ARCOVrlAvgndiiOvXrkotS76m5YziHkq6yIJm-xQQtXGQToCy1uZy4tuB2QyuO3X0VGJvFzKn3vnEjU6SU_H8wHBwLY2patuuifUH_qYerd1-MvDx7uSkEJywU_n4HL8DNbjOt6GAgtalC72I2-Fuu7gXrBB-0x9Jk1OfI-DPHMJHcqq7ZlYhaaimyhPCH9jPB1ZNqcZAG5kmj_BrcNijuG7_alVXSk7UHtVn72w2IuAgRK2hKUBKjIrtAjxwkHM56_2kn6e5bg5xlFWcbJCIVkK22a5=w1024-h683-no

Instructions?#&?#&Mix together flour, yeast, salt, sugar, mint leaves, chopped onions, cumin seeds, flax seeds and sesame seeds. Make sure everything is well distributed.?#&Add oil, warm water and buttermilk substitute and mix well.?#&Knead by hand for 20 minutes or electric whisk for 10 minutes to form a smooth dough. Oil the dough well and place it in a bowl.?#&Cover with a damp cloth and let the dough rise for 1 hour or till it doubles in volume.?#&Grease a baking pan. Add some semolina or cornmeal all over the pan. Preheat oven to 180 C 350 F?#&Form equal-sized buns out of the dough and place it on the baking pan. Place them 1 or 2 inches away from each other.?#&Cover the buns loosely with plastic wrap and let it sit in a warm spot for 20-30 minutes. This lets the buns rise again.?#&Brush the top with some melted butter.?#&Bake in a 180 C preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the buns are fully cooked through.?#&Remove and let them cool for 5 minutes.?#&Enjoy warm buns with some nice masala chai!?#&?#&Note?#&?#&You can store them in an air tight container for 2 days in the fridge. Warm for 20 seconds in the microwave before serving ingredients?#&?#&Note 2 – Buttermilk or Buttermilk Substitute?#&?#&Indians know Buttermilk as a thinned form of yogurt. But this is not that.?#&You can use store bought buttermilk. Or add add 1 teaspoon Vinegar to 1/2 cup milk. Mix and well and let it curdle for 20-30 minutes. Instructions?#&?#&Filling?#&?#&Grilled / Saute the vegetables and add them to the cream cheese.?#&Add the rest of the seasoning to suit your taste. Mix well.?#&You can make this a day or two in advance too and store in the refrigerator.?#&?#&Forming the lasagna rolls?#&?#&Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt to it.?#&Add and cook the lasagna noodles one by one. You need to make sure they’re well cooked (al dente).?#&Remove the noodles on a clean kitchen cloth. Let it cool for a minute or two.?#&Spread some butter / garlic butter on the noodles (optional).?#&To one third of the length of the noodles closest to you, add some of the cream cheese filling.?#&Pick up from the shorter side closest to you a fold it onto the filling. Because the noodles are warm and slightly sticky, the will stick properly.?#&Continue to roll through the length of the noodles. Seal the edges of the rolls on all sides. Seal the middle with a toothpick. If your noodles seal without the toothpick, that is fine too.?#&Coat a thin layer of bread crumbs on all sides of the lasagna rolls. Place the noodles in a box. Let them chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. This ensures that the rolls are properly sealed.?#&?#&Option 1: Frying the lasagna rolls?#&?#&Heat some oil on a pan.?#&Shallow fry on both sides on medium flame for 4-5 minutes each or until the rolls are crispy and golden brown.?#&Remove on a tissue paper to absorb excess oil.?#&?#&Option 2: Baking the lasagna rolls?#&?#&Preheat oven to 200C / 405F.?#&Add the rolls onto a baking pan and brush both sides with oil.?#&Bake one side for 10-15 minutes; turn the rolls and continue to bake for another 8-10 minutes.?#&You should look for a crispy outer layer on both sides.?#&?#&Serve hot with your favorite condiment?#&?#&This is best served fresh only.?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&If the lasagna noodles aren’t fully cooked, they will break when you make the rolls.?#&They are similar to spring rolls, however the edges are open. Ingredients?#&?#&Lasagna Noodles?#&Filling of your choice?#&Butter / Garlic Butter – optional?#&Grated Cheese – optional?#&Bread crumbs?#&Vegetable Oil, as required?#&Water?#&Salt?#&Clean Kitchen cloth?#&?#&Filling – Grilled Veggie with Cream Cheese?#&?#&2 cups Chopped Vegetables of your choice?#&1/2 cup Cream Cheese?#&Salt, to taste?#&1 teaspoon Ground Black Pepper?#&1–2 teaspoons Oregano?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&You can make any filling you like. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/6OvNn49FSrHu5mUlwXUoGZ9cnhymRid87eyqc51Dw_L0G9B2loEUMJSytJkPF3gXiiWgcErfLiCvcfnZEHyPF6t-Q_8Mceu-dPp8LaMnuAYUpgEaJT9Jvkhgf1WoZV48LgIRa9eI3lk5TSIJllwaNj-w34o55CT6NanQ5rMquIETaxp94HWjRwdcLQ9L9sG7YlvXJQzyxRIM9ZuIX8m9cQG9-2gtw1Y5pfq4othSqY9L9ZchLqKfUQoeqxylyD6-HFyftx-1W-ZefFtUBfZJi1sgdYjBF71JixbCaC-kvWLGWb3QwTHMeg-XBXUyED33Z8VRz208BJOZ9Nz1Ged0HbECunS8OQLnB9J07mwaLjCFLz_wHyzNDMMhT8_KuXQaX-E-Ou71PxrBCdwEp_RHxoJfwVDLtadDUzo90cbhtSq3HdNhV71C8pEF4Ez_j1V_srkP6BjG_8DdFop6vg9_6g0846EAoLvoQJNOPxZnUCrWJkS-pGxE3_t2dBkDUKPvJKEZKM2noyRMJ2yRyUqAeFWl3Qa3EYpjklSkS2mePpAIxjOiHANkm2vBktJwFroK6PK5nVUf3mSjSMtIm1ps5hw5FmJN9Z8oNVyvKKehmVpQNd1kUVR5=w835-h851-no
Rocky Road Cupcakes Kavitha Ramaswamy 10 mins 30 mins 40 mins 6 cupcake American 4 Jul 03, 2015 https://foodomania.com/rocky-road-cupcakes-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&Preheat oven to 160 C / 325 F. (Reduce to 140 or 150 C if using convection oven) Line cupcake mold with liners.?#&Mix together the dry ingredients – flour, cocoa, sugar, salt, espresso powder, baking powder and baking soda – well. Set aside.?#&Mix together yogurt, oil, vanilla extract and melted butter.?#&Sift in the dry ingredients. Gently mix to form a smooth, lump-free batter.?#&Add half of the marshmallows, chocolate and nuts and mix well to distribute evenly.?#&Scoop out the cake batter into the cupcake mold. Bake for 25 minutes at 160 C.?#&Remove the cupcakes, top them with marshmallow and chocolate. Bake for another 5-7 minutes until the chocolate starts to melt and the marshmallows start to roast.?#&Let them cool for a bit; unmold and enjoy.?#&Have them warm or at room temperature.?#&To store, place in an air tight box and store in the fridge. Before eating, warm it up slightly Ingredients?#&?#&For the chocolate cupake?#&?#&1 cup All Purpose Flour?#&1/4 cup unsweetened Cocoa Powder (adjust as per intensity of chocolate flavor required)?#&1/2 cup Powdered Sugar (adjust to taste)?#&a pinch of Salt?#&a pinch of Instant Espresso Powder (or 2 teaspoons Coffee) – optional?#&1 teaspoon Baking Soda?#&1/2 teaspoon Baking Powder?#&1/3 cup Sour Cream or Plain Yogurt?#&1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract?#&1/4 cup Vegetable Oil?#&2 Tablespoons Melted Butter?#&?#&Others?#&?#&1/2 cup chopped Nuts (any or a mixture of Almonds, Walnuts, Pistachios, Cashew etc)?#&1/2 cup chopped or mini Marshmallows?#&1/2 cup Chopped Chocolate?#&?#&Note – If you’re a Vegetarian or Vegan, use Vegan Marshmallows. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-7A9rCUr87bM/VZuFRApuZxI/AAAAAAAAQ04/a8NXuNbjsFw/s512/Rocky%252520Road%252520Cupcakes%252520Recipe%25252001.JPG

Buttermilk Biscuits from scratch Kavitha Ramaswamy 1 hour 20 mins 1 hour 20 mins 20 baking English 2 Aug 13, 2017 https://foodomania.com/buttermilk-biscuits-from-scratch-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&For the dough?#&?#&Mix all purpose flour, salt and baking powder well.?#&Add the very cold grated / chopped butter pieces into the flour.?#&Using a fork, incorporate the butter into the entire flour mixture.?#&Add the cold buttermilk and mix with a fork to form a dough.?#&Lay a plastic sheet on a work surface and dump the flour mixture in the center.?#&Using the sides of the sheet, try to form a dough. Don’t work it too much. Your aim should be to bring everything together into one piece.?#&Seal the dough well with the plastic and return it to the fridge for at least 30 minutes.?#&?#&Working the dough?#&?#&Take a good portion of the dough (about 1/4 th) and flatten a little. Place some flour to help you roll the dough easily.?#&Roll it into a thin rectangle. Sprinkle flour on the surface and on the dough to prevent it from sticking.?#&From the shorter side of the rectangle opposite to you, fold the dough in one-thirds. Then fold the shorter side closest to you over the already folded side. Seal well. This is ONE envelope. This helps in creating the flaky layers.?#&Sprinkle some more flour and roll out the envelope into a rectangle. Repeat the same process of folding the layers.?#&Repeat a total of three times. Then freeze it for 15 minutes at least.?#&?#&Making the buttermilk biscuits?#&?#&Preheat oven to 200 C / 410 F?#&Remove the folded envelope of the dough and roll it gently such that it is of a 1-2 inch thickness.?#&Use a cookie cutter or any biscuit cutter to cut out the biscuits.?#&Re-roll any excess dough and form more biscuits?#&Place each one at a distance of 1/2 an inch from the other on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.?#&Brush each of the biscuits with melted butter or some buttermik?#&Bake at 200 C for 15-20 minutes or until the biscuits puff up, turn golden brown and are fully cooked through.?#&Let them cool for 5 minutes.?#&Slice and serve with jam, nutella, curry or whatever you like!?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&If it seems like the butter is starting to melt, keep the mixing bowl in the freezer for a few minutes. It is crucial to keep the butter and flour separated to maintain the flakiness.?#&While forming the dough, use as little of your hands as possible. Your hands have warmth. They tend to melt the butter and that defeats the purpose of the dough.?#&As much as possible, work really quickly while forming the dough or the biscuits. If you live in a humid environment, work closely to a refrigerator and an AC. It is very important to keep the butter and flour separated.?#&You can store the dough as is, or after rolling and folding. Either way wrap tightly with a plastic cover or sheet and place in the freezer. This dough freezes well for a month?#&You can use leftover dough to make anything you like – garlic rolls, veggie rolls, twisters, dough bites etc. ingredients are cold all the time. If required, keep returning them to the fridge while working so that they are cold?#&?#&Buttermilk – If you can’t find buttermilk, mix one cup of milk with 1-2 TBSP fresh lemon juice or vinegar, mix well & let it sit in room temperature for 20 minutes till the milk curdles. This is your buttermilk substitute https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/kw8WI413N32o3v9212S5_2dzmz4EVs_MdTWwg-6IP48C41xaDTqrSWw3wLYAZusoxxh8OqYAvuoVud10ReltU9T2jod1skzJ6rhojM7NwhmRx211TwUYw3Z86MkwqWvGZp9pVOTowL6Blif0K_UhD5lYVQKdWzCi49fU5ElB_O-Vww-vqsHY64X2Lpt97a2mZRDXHfXzlyhQp_pT0dcc8rA5HViD1aojtbpH0r3GHMMKDWXI-vP8tkyko4ynwVtLhrLg1VRuMWs7_kzrVEmhnHc_WQ6TbuTop4xeLEbus-W6al2riHhYtZvaZ3MluPNzgICJ7DdZnTVlM1PThlokFxPAtB1rRgq5oqHhyO3vhYoi43poQdndyy3EzgyCYHrPN2s-mIH6ZjR8qUE5wo4E5e2ESD-SsBNREuZUlDSiCwQjW12dDcKKa5oQu1FghtAJ2o4qshIGCTp_tNLwgU1-x_w5jSAoyyzxZz0JiE9cTqvZKnOswo0ZS2KaKbfhwvnzJmOwwy9AYOw0aUkyKvGKG1TuzFoAPMQiWAWlImAy2Lyj2F0ZcguNIq91cVNBRxYhRGzIGoymfDcmZmc8T2fBleUKt8TgSRoqM-dJAlO4gQzAuGckpWkkV04N=w914-h851-no

Instructions?#&?#&To a blender / food processor, add onion, tomato, garlic, chili.?#&Grind to a smooth puree.?#&Heat oil in a pan.?#&Add the puree to the oil and mix well.?#&Stir and cook for 3-4 minutes.?#&Cover and cook for 8 minutes.?#&Open the lid and stir every 1-2 minutes to avoid the sauce from sticking to the pan. Instructions?#&?#&Filling – you can make the below filling or use any leftover filling?#&?#&Heat oil and add the chilli, ginger and garlic. Fry for a few seconds?#&Add the mixed veggies and fry on high heat for 2-3 minutes.?#&Add the vinegar, soy sauce, salt, pepper and mix well. Fry for a few minutes.?#&Add the shredded cabbage / lettuce and fry for another 2 minutes.?#&Let the mixture cool.?#&?#&To make the Grilled Roti Sandwich?#&?#&Brush a grill pan / toaster / panini press with some oil.?#&Add some condiment / sauce all over the roti. To one half of the roti, add some filling. Wrap it into a neat tight roll.?#&Place the roll seam-side down on the greased grill press. Brush the top with some oil and close the pan. Let it grill for around 3-5 minutes or until you like the texture of the sandwich.?#&Remove, cut it into 2-3 pieces and serve with your favorite sauce. Ingredients?#&?#&4 Rotis / Tortillas?#&1 cup of your favorite filling?#&4 Tablespoons of your favorite sauce / condiment?#&Vegetable Oil?#&Grill Pan / Panini Press / Sandwich Toaster?#&?#&Roti?#&?#&You can use leftovr roti / chapati / phulka or any tortilla you have on hand?#&?#&Filling options – Make any filling you like. Below is the one I use for spring rolls?#&?#&1 cup shredded Lettuce / Cabbage?#&1 cup mixed grated veggies (onion, carrots, capsicum)?#&2 Green Chilli, slit in the middle?#&1 teaspoon minced Garlic?#&1 teaspoon minced Ginger?#&1 teaspoon Vinegar?#&1 teaspoon Soy sauce?#&1/2 teaspoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1/2 teaspoon ground Black Pepper?#&2 teaspoons Vegetable Oil?#&?#&Sauce / Condiments?#&?#&Choose a sauce / dip that goes with the filling you’re using. Instructions?#&?#&Preheat oven to 160 C (320 F). Preheat to 140 C or 150 C (300 F) if using a convection oven.?#&Grease and line a cake tin.?#&Cream together butter and sugar for 1-2 minutes till you have a smooth and creamy mixture.?#&Add some yogurt and espresso powder or prepared coffee and mix well.?#&Sift in the flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Mix well to form a smooth and lump-free batter. If the batter is too thick, add some milk or water and mix well to form an easy batter. Don’t overmix or you will end up with a tough bread-like consistency.?#&Pour the batter into a prepared cake tin. Bake at 160 C for 25-30 minutes or until the cake is well done. To check if it is cooked, insert a toothpick or dry piece of spaghetti in the center of the cake. If it comes out smooth without leaving any wet batter, it is done.?#&Let the cake cool. Remove it from the tin and slice it into squares.?#&Enjoy with some coffee or tea or as is! Arrabbiata Sauce with Pasta Kavitha Ramaswamy 10 mins 25 mins 35 mins 4 cups condiments Italian 1 Jun 17, 2017 https://foodomania.com/arrabbiata-sauce-recipe-pasta/
Instructions?#&?#&Boil tomatoes and peel the skin. Grind to a smooth puree. (or used ready made canned tomatoes or tomato puree instead)?#&Heat oil in a pan. Add the minced garlic and hot pepper flakes. Fry for a minute on medium flame.?#&Add in the blanched tomato puree or canned tomatoes and mix well. Reduce the heat to medium-low and allow it to cook for about 20 minutes or until the sauce is nice and thick.?#&You should look for the raw smell of the tomatoes to go away. Flavor it with salt and pepper. You can also add more spices like oregano, parsley, thyme and mix well. Taste and adjust for seasoning. Switch off the flame.?#&Garnish with fresh parsley. Mix well. Your arrabbiata sauce is ready?#&?#&To Serve?#&?#&To serve pasta arrabbiata, simply cook pasta till al dente. Add enough of the sauce to the pasta. You can also add grilled veggies, chicken, bacon etc. Mix well. Grate some cheese over the top if desired and serve.?#&You can use this as a sauce on Pizza base or even as a dipping sauce.?#&?#&Note?#&?#&If you want, you can also add some finely chopped onion while frying the garlic Ingredients?#&?#&8 medium Tomatoes (Read note 1)?#&1 Tablespoon Olive Oil (or alternatively vegetable oil)?#&6 cloves Garlic, minced finely?#&3 teaspoons Hot Pepper Flakes (adjust to suit your taste)?#&1 teaspoon Sugar?#&1 Tablespoon Salt (adjust to taste)?#&2 teaspoons Ground Black Pepper?#&1/2 cup Water?#&1/4 cup chopped Parsley (or cilantro)?#&Mixed spices – Oregano, Thyme, Parsley, Basil etc, – optional?#&?#&To Serve?#&?#&Pasta?#&Arrabbiata Sauce?#&Cheese?#&Grilled Veggies, Chicken, Bacon etc. – optional?#&?#&Note?#&?#&You need the puree of blanched tomatoes. You can alternatively also used canned tomatoes.?#&This recipe doesn’t use onions. Apple Onion Chutney Kavitha Ramaswamy 10 mins 30 mins 40 mins 1 cup Condiment
2 Jun 09, 2017 https://foodomania.com/apple-onion-chutney-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&Grate Onion and Apple. You can also add it to a food processor and grate coarsely.?#&To a wok or a pan with high sides, add vegetable oil. When it heats, add onion and mix well. Fry for 4-5 minutes on medium flame until the onions start to sweat. Add a little salt to the onions and fry till they get mildly caramelized.?#&Then add in the grated apple and a splash of apple juice or water.?#&Close the pan and let it cook on medium low heat for 10-12 minutes. Frequently open and stir to avoid burning.?#&Once the mixture has reduced to a mush and oil starts to come out from the sides of the mixture, you can add the spices – red chilli powder, sugar, salt and anything else you like. Mix well and continue to fry for another 5-7 minutes on medium flame.?#&Taste and adjust for seasoning. It is done when it becomes a mushy paste and the raw smell of onion or apple isn’t there anymore.?#&Store in an air tight jar and serve as a condiment. Ingredients?#&?#&1 medium Onion?#&1 medium Apple?#&1/4 cup Apple Juice (or Water)?#&3 Tablespoon Vegetable Oil?#&2 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)?#&2 teaspoons Red Chilli Powder or Hot Pepper Flakes?#&1 teaspoon Sugar or Jaggery or Brown Sugar (adjust to taste)?#&1 Tablespoon Spices per taste (Refer Note)?#&?#&Note – Spices – Use whatever you like – some examples –?#&?#&Indian – Garam Masala, Cumin powder, coriander powder, chaat powder?#&Mexican – Piri piri, cumin, mexican spices?#&Italian – oregano, thyme, parsley, garlic etc.?#&and so on… https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/XMLqmWD8KDzy2Q6amtvv8tXsWvKGEZttRbrutBRbZi1IgSVTEJhVWp4-sHQRBh9rLk3uLn8KpCVGRkgzyjuOsq56-EW-lHayvSi0xxavIAXbnX08MK2LHF5f7n4SIlpKvJbf4iJpjaaC1kXgqO9SiK30HhH4TDp7I7GRn6laF3T1GQATiY9mPLOfTXhOwtRkE8aiuWPKYQYMSTjKzuLcugnHDaglVJ1_XpNC6wZR91qK2rlMDxV5JJ3Dv14SbFA-iGb4AU0qjswGW4HdyhWaI_RoU-k2AwY35PL158Z0ZyAPUSJfID-EvxxUztLZn-0ujxcWqXyyB6VYeXt5k-J1LUf3BvzoZ7vSr8MCKqeEeV3lId1X6MmEQMDe3c_29WSSOyLYUj7l-fV0wkdRISTHtoS079hU-pM5TXNJ3w0dyIQIwBVO9DyGf9uqWqzf906GJxto1fkGgiYYFnnk959VGt7uk7ZzCtBS1mtsgwozSbCLzLMbKKqJCC5wbT4mOscwC6eusXB2Y5binXdv6VeloRIHrUQZeH50RePFpBiRottmi0znnjoc_ktyUEhrJmOIsSuISn46Kg-EvgobuCthijLkTmoDf97dZnyVNWcFNEKi1V4ZypIf=w904-h885-no
Tender Coconut Ice Cream Kavitha Ramaswamy 9 hours 30 mins 9 hours 30 mins 1/2 Dessert
1 Jun 04, 2017 https://foodomania.com/tender-coconut-ice-cream-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&Mix cornstarch, GMS, CMC with 1/4 cup of milk and set aside.?#&Add the remaining milk and cream to a pan and bring it to a boil.?#&Add sugar and mix well for it to dissolve. Taste and add more sugar if required. Once the sugar has dissolved, reduce the heat to medium low and stir it frequently to avoid burning. Let it boil for around 15 minutes while you stir constantly. This reduces the milk mixture a bit and makes the final ice cream texture more creamy.?#&Lower the flame and slowly add the milk-cornflour mixture while stirring constantly. Keep cooking on medium heat while constantly stirring. Cook till you have a thick custard.?#&Add a little condensed milk for extra creaminess. (You can avoid this too if you don’t want a very creamy texture). When you dip a wooden spoon and the mixture coats the back of the spoon, it is done. Switch off the flame?#&Add a drop or two for additional coconut-y flavor and mix well. (optional)?#&Stir the mixture while it cools to avoid forming a skin on the surface.?#&Once the mixture is cooled – most crucial step – pass the mixture through a sieve / filter to catch any lumps. This gives a smooth texture to the ice cream.?#&Pour into a shallow container (preferably with a lid). Cover the container with plastic wrap and freeze until almost set (about 3-4 hours). Make sure to set your freezer to coldest temperature.?#&Remove, add 2-3 tablespoons of milk and whisk well to break up any ice crystals and incorporate air into the mixture. If the mixture is too hard, let it rest at room temperature for about 5 minutes. If you don’t have a hand held whisk, you can add the mixture to a food processor or a blender and blend for 3-4 minutes till you have a creamy mixture.?#&Pour the mixture back into the same shallow container. Let it set for another 2-3 hours.?#&Repeat this process once more. i.e – remove, whip / blend to a smooth mixture and freeze again for 2-4 hours.?#&Before the final whisking of the ice cream, add flesh of the tender coconut to a blender and grind it for a few seconds to break it up. You can grind less or more depending on how big you want the tender coconut pieces in the ice cream to be. You can also chop it by hand.?#&Add the ice cream to the blender with the tender coconut meat and whip again till the mixture doubles in volume. You will notice that by the 3rd whisk, the color of the ice cream turns into white and the volume also doubles. Again pour into the dish, close and let it freeze completely.?#&Remove the ice cream 5 minutes before you want to serve. Scoop out and serve.?#&Enjoy!?#&?#&Note?#&?#&Freeze & whip for a total of at least 3 times to give a smooth and creamy texture to the ice cream Ingredients?#&?#&300 mls (1.5 cups) Full Fat Milk (refer note)?#&200 mls (1 cup) Cream (refer note)?#&1 Tablespoon Cornstarch (cornflour)?#&1.5 Tablespoons G.M.S (Glycerol monostearate)?#&1/5 teaspoon C.M.C (Carboxy methyl cellulose)?#&2 Tablespoons sweetened Condensed Milk (optional)?#&3/4 cup Regular Sugar (adjust to suit your taste for sweetness)?#&1/4 teaspoon Coconut Extract (optional)?#&2 cups Tender Coconut Meat?#&?#&1 cup is around 200 ml?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&G.M.S (Glycerol monostearate) – GMS is a food additive used as a thickening, emulsifying, anti-caking, and preservative agent; an emulsifying agent for oils, waxes, and solvents. GMS is largely used in baking preparations to add “body” to the food. It is responsible for giving ice cream and whipped cream its smooth texture. It contains both water & oil soluble groups in one molecule. This characteristic structure enables it to be a very effective emulsifier. Another important advantage to G.M.S. is high nutritive value. It is non toxic & therefore very suitable for use in food formulation. It belongs to the class of non ionic emulsifiers.?#&C.M.C (Carboxy methyl cellulose) – CMC is a compound used for stabilizing ice creams and is available in specialty food stores or bakeries. Use only as much as given in the recipe. Using excessive CMC can cause ice crystals in the ice cream.?#&Milk / Cream – Make sure you use full fat milk. Even better is to use half milk and half cream (half and half). The more fat content in the dairy you use, the creamier will be the texture. You can also make this ice cream with just milk.?#&Buy tender coconut with the flesh (meat / malai). The malai in the coconut is what gives this ice cream a great flavor and texture.?#&Coconut Extract is optional. If you really want a strong flavor, then you can add a drop or two of the extract. https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/5ONPy6MisFptJWNuf_lYs_xhulbq-EXRXtd3zNr9fJHL5v4BSbKEBbH03H9o2QN7fUkn6hkG-ptltpl_J1QeDl84T7fkQhJqfP1_rBekImHM2GS7dfRxvL0AVAX4w4FBbJWqrmRqPGHuBIMlm-kAY-k4qwpfn6xd6ZM7pDLtUgzlEJRZXT2QdxgmlWdz05k_KN3AKFsugjsYqiRjjhZQKtWtai0qSbBAXIjccwdvAAiNDmIiZC1gYRgLNCiQX0sAZ8mLYcWg-hLK2oGUAX5lxV2AXGrCeSuOfDXVpLM-gTZZJxEgXbc6_xe2-6STPdSaNXTrwV4Z17uMH6z9iDuutIQCJPjr29_E8Wnk3o2-IatvtjVKxYq47yyFfoSHe-otVIpd3OQAKox9uxbiCK8JLDp6ABPJDRrtxOX8msti-nz0MH0e_Z9Kcw7f8_bx4LegqEDNKbFgt_EXG2x9WZ43p7eQob__KZDZDSmuCtu7VYuOY7twmFkfIS08vjq5zMcccpPnPaD_wa11LfbUaHM7grRY9b7_PLPuGjtw0EPaCC09FRokjd_bshoyIlZaBXXNcs_1B0xw1anA9ZcvreL-_nzD9X48GAKyrLmHEts_cXpcDo-rINx2=w780-h642-no
Eggless Mango Mousse Kavitha Ramaswamy 6 hours 20 mins 6 hours 20 mins 2 Dessert
0 Jun 01, 2017 https://foodomania.com/eggless-mango-mousse-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&Cut the pulp out of the mango and blend it to a smooth puree. Set aside.?#&Add agar agar / gelatin to water and let it boil for a minute or 2 until it dissolves.?#&Also mix cornstarch (cornflour) with 1/4 cup of Milk and set aside.?#&Add sugar to milk and bring it to a boil. Keep stirring to avoid sugar or milk burning. Once the sugar dissolves, reduce the heat to medium low and let it boil for 5-6 minutes. This helps make the mousse texture a lot creamier. Taste and adjust for sweetness at this stage.?#&Add the cornstarch-milk mixture to the milk and keep stirring continuously. Cook on low heat till you get a thick custard like consistency.?#&Add the agar-agar / gelatin mixture and mix well. Switch off the flame and continue stirring as it cools completely. This ensures that there is no skin that forms on the surface of the mixture.?#&Add the mango puree to the pudding-like mixture and mix well.?#&Once the mixture is cool, add whipped cream and fold it in until it is fully mixed.?#&To a serving glass, add some mango puree to the bottom and fill it with mango mousse and top it off with more mango puree. Close with a lid / foil and refrigerate for a few hours or until it is set completely.?#&Serve with a slice of mango on top.?#&?#&Note?#&?#&This stays well in the refrigerator for up to a week. Ingredients?#&?#&1 Fresh, Ripe Mango (*Refer Note 1)?#&1 Tablespoon Agar Agar flakes / Gelatin?#&1/4 cup Water?#&1 Tablespoon Cornstarch?#&1 and 1/4 cup Milk (preferably full fat whole milk)?#&1/4 cup Tablespoons of Sugar (adjust to taste)?#&1 cup sweetened Whipped Cream (*Note 2)?#&?#&Notes?#&?#&If Mangoes are not in season, you can use frozen mango puree too.?#&Use 1/2 cup of cold heavy whipping cream and 1/4 cup powdered sugar and whip together to form stiff peaks. Or use readily available whipped cream https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/GkySxUGcFqpMOawgehER5BZF7TfFudMAkv82CU5qboHBz5v0l9M4DVqIn2-CLjzTuJiRSHKmAAxNUyWMEzHySkxjU6v-m9JYkwOre2QQf-41okhRZqfrx_vVKBfR7iHqdGoFZGZ7YCKIHFXhsw0aVGNBWdOf9mY-j_1zPV-QNoxWQ4znlWrexiDTZ_lvLNC-BPkHM467A6pwKHf0AP9uECYWJCGjC_q5NE7HhV7AJl_CfHYhEWvq2ATaB6w3ZHxHCCz0UJybSusjE0Qc_4MH9ABp7Scec7YvMmDprV1GPHJo9a3d1tOyBG_EIfbokZke_lEaJYfsbNL9sbuCglQhBXMwDA4k-E47JCpAteTNbaJK7NoO9egNrRY01TW1ITbGwpwxiGLKnCgH1h0mGwUaPp8c1v_5toNlYnclN8iEra8vCZh7lt8m-kPUgxdJtGevPLy2ffRFXwb5TmxtBkPb1Ri3AvTjjdBmSMY6BI-7BZk58RIm82oFjUhTuUyFaOZxZWVSCKwImZ7HVdQE1MWiovTekPhHPO6LnQJUkX7xFE4d_oA3c5W9sF9v18AhhAMQDauUn9BwElCp9i4hcFdiaGsgMBCF2-NWfpc_8KB7PzWtighIKH5O=w985-h884-no
Javvarisi Vadaam (Sabudana Fryums) Kavitha Ramaswamy 60 hours 30 mins 60 hours 30 mins 10 cups Snack Indian 0 May 29, 2017 https://foodomania.com/javvarisi-vadaam-sabudana-fryums-recipe/
Instructions?#&?#&To make the Sabudana Fryums (Vadaam)?#&?#&Soak the Sabudana (Tapioca Pearls) overnight in enough water to cover them. Discard the water next day.?#&Add it to a food processor or a blender and grind to a coarse paste.?#&Add the green chilli, a splash of water and 1/2 teaspoon salt to a food processor and grind to a smooth liquid-y paste?#&Boil 1 litre water in a large pan with high sides. Once it comes to a boil, add 1 and 1/2 teaspoons of Salt, 2 Tablespoons of Vegetable Oil and the Green Chilli Paste and mix well.?#&Add the ground Sabudana paste to the boiling water and start to stir with a ladle. I’ve found using a wooden spoon makes the process a lot easier. Keep stirring constantly.?#&Cook on medium heat. It’ll start to come together in about 5-7 minutes. The ground sabudana will make the mixture gooey.?#&At this point, taste and add more salt if required. Add carom seeds (ajwain) and mix well. Don’t stop stirring.?#&The mixture will start to get more and more transparent and will fall off from the ladle easily when picked up.?#&To check if it is done, you’ll need to do 2 things – a) Pick some mixture on a spoon and let it cool. Press the sabudana pearls to check if they are soft and mushy. b) Dip your hand in water and pat the surface of the mixture. It shouldn’t stick to your hand. Switch off the flame.?#&Lay a clean kitchen cloth or plastic on a hard surface. Start to scoop out the mixture and pour it on the cloth. Drop each portion at a distance of 1/2 an inch from each other.?#&Once you pour some of the mixture on the surface, dip you fingers in water and pat each one to flatten it.?#&Place the board/table on which you’ve poured the mixture under the sun.?#&It will take around 2 days under hot sun to dry up completely. You should look for a completely dry mixture. If it is gooey or wet it will not fry up properly and will spoil sooner. That’s about it!?#&?#&To Serve?#&?#&If you want to eat these fryums, just deep fry them in hot oil until well done.?#&?#&Note?#&?#&Please remember – when fried, these fryums tend to get over salty. So its best to keep the mixture just a tad under-salted.?#&You’re looking for a flat vadaam for a crispy version. It also dries up sooner. It can be thicker too. It’ll just take longer to dry up.?#&If you don’t have access to the sun for a longer time, you can dry it at home under a fan too. But it is best when sun-dried. Ingredients?#&?#&To make the Sabudana Fryums (Vadaam)?#&?#&500 grams Sabudana (Javvarisi / Sago / Tapioca Pearls)?#&10 medium Green Chilli?#&2 teaspoons Salt (adjust to taste)?#&1000 mls (1 litre) Water?#&2 Tablespoon Vegetable Oil?#&1 Tablespoon Carom Seeds (ajwain / omam)?#&?#&Others – Equipment?#&?#&A large pan with high sides or a large pressure cooker?#&A board or table?#&A clean kitchen cloth or plastic cover?#&An ice cream scoop or ladle with a scoop?#&Ladle or Long Wooden Spoon (preferably a wooden one)?#&?#&To Serve?#&?#&Oil, for deep frying?#&Dried Sabudana Fryums https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/v1eYnez9t9zcaZ5NRfWE5B02FqQN99QaV-bHniaHeKCWGCt6jxZ2QJsGkhcqtfMLYOut7XanEwgx_gfHwRraFx2G70GJalC7-GtbumBypeohi1jYnyDlsTtMSPF4D1p4zKsLa8DMiEOlJXr0yXf-ouwy2mcdHdkTRsj5ZGlak9y2QIjMW3rEV_DjT-U6UeqzCgwUkxmcGCCWr1vdAmYPhsk-cI1WSWsOsA50CKJZ1p0_BNuF8aJlU6qKDR3jko5wzIZ_uRCClPPabM6ZYMdJf5T09LLyEgfTtSAAbZqYy5AGuNaJvt7NdYwfTHBQ6wrJFAEHoji-1vj9GU41TARHnhcb6SenzHY99R1Uh4wfVoB7BWPICTrlHhVcI0YdhpnGaMmTZCJrfDMSDIz2gH9bxay0PX9nI9Nbu0HAqqOzJeOOoY8lQw5XqZ0izp4V1FLl_Zn7qNAxntBE90gWA1FRgOiAauKBxErxLek6a4YEn4tNtjzrHFm9130Zcb9mfM-VTRe3vnRyWkDinHKV1hQ-iydjfZqQqHLXgQJb3xX1dPrjmAa7XDeHrb-k4VPvM8jPmEIfdNNiP8EaeSU6vkaCnPOAQkiYbgKuU41q7h9ahVOy8temhQQs=w700-h620-no
